availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Christopher C. Terrell (Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Son of Menon Terrell and Mettie Terrell. Married to Ann E. Hall Terrell on April 5, 1853. Father of Virginia Terrell, Paul Terrell, Wilmot Terrell, William Terrell, Thomas B. Terrell, Martha C. Terrell, Diago Terrell, and Lena Terrell. Farmer in Ballard County in 1850 and 1860. Owned sixteen enslaved persons in 1850 and thirteen in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 288. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 129. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Tharps District, p. 135. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Tharps District, p. 14. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, District 2, p. 20. Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), Microfilm rolls #994027-994058, Ballard County, Marriages, 1853, Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives, Frankfort, Kentucky (accessed via Ancestry). Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), Microfilm rolls #994027-994058, Ballard County, Deaths, 1876, Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives, Frankfort, Kentucky (accessed via Ancestry).
